headline: Hearty Vegetable Lasagna
description: This hearty vegetable lasagna is packed full of flavor from mushrooms, peppers, and onions. And it's easy to make and is the perfect comfort food.

video.description: Layers of flavors make this 5-star lasagna a hearty hit.
video.name: Hearty Vegetable Lasagna

name: Hearty Vegetable Lasagna

recipeInstructions.text: Cook lasagna noodles in a large pot of boiling water for 10 minutes, or until al dente. Rinse with cold water, and drain.

Heat oil in a large saucepan. Add mushrooms, green peppers, onion, and garlic; cook and stir until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in pasta sauce and basil; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, and simmer for 15 minutes.
While the sauce is simmering, mix together ricotta, 2 cups mozzarella cheese, and eggs in a medium bowl.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.

Spread 1 cup cooked tomato and vegetable sauce into the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Lay down 1/2 of the lasagna noodles and layer 1/2 each of the ricotta mix, sauce, and Parmesan cheese on top. Repeat layering again with noodles, ricotta mix, sauce, and Parmesan cheese. Top with remaining 2 cups mozzarella.
Bake in the preheated oven, uncovered, for 40 minutes. Let stand for 15 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: awesome recipe!!!! We all loved it.

11.13.22 update: Made this again tonight and I really enjoyed it, although my kids did not really take to it ("ewww, mushrooms"). Very easy recipe. I added more chopped onions, a zucchini and a summer squash. ------------ I used more mushrooms and started cooking them first, then added the remaining ingredients to saute without adding oil because of the liquid that expelled from the mushrooms. I accidentally used more mozzarella than called for, but you can never go wrong with more mozzarella. Very easy and straightforward recipes.
I tried it for the first time and it was a success! Thank you for this recipe!

This was quite good, and this recipe will become my base recipe. Guests complimented it. Of course, I did make some of my own changes :) The recipe doesn't indicate any use of salt. I knew I needed salt in the veggie sauce (I used ¼ tsp Kosher), and I also added a pinch of granulated salt to the ricotta/egg/cheese mixture. I usually lay out all the ingredients ahead of time, & I think the recipe should indicate how much salt is needed at each step (or at least say "salt to taste" just to remind me). I also think the recipe needed more seasoning. I used 1 tsp of dried Herbes de Provence in the veggie sauce. I used fresh basil and fresh tarragon, which I added to the ricotta/egg/cheese mixture. I used 2 different tomato sauces for the veggie sauce mixture because that is what I had on hand. One of those tomato sauces had a bit of pepper heat to it. If that had not been the case, I would have added some sort of hot pepper seasoning. I added ½ a package of frozen spinach because I like spinach in lasagna. I did NOT need a whole package of lasagna noodles - probably only ½ the package. I tented aluminum foil over the dish in the oven for the 1st half of the cooking, and then turned broil on for the last 5 minutes or so. I tried the AllRecipes drop down to scale the recipe to fewer than 12 servings, but that messed up the mozzarella proportions, so I just made the 12 serving recipe. Guests had plenty, I had plenty over a few days, and there's one final piece in the freezer for later!
It was a dinner hit! Used the oven ready noodles and it made things oh so much easier.
I used Rao's marinara (which we love) and added a bit of broccoli, zucchini, carrots and spinach. My husband gave it a 4 out of 5. He said he would be happy to have it again.
I used no boil lasagna and added carrots with the zucchini and summer squash. It was a family favorite!

It was delicious. I made this for our Valentine's Dinner. I changed a few things...I used Barilla Oven Ready Lasagna Noodles and added some spices ..salt, pepper, Italian seasoning and red pepper flakes. But followed the rest of the recipe. 

I will make this again but would add more garlic cloves, maybe 5 total .

It's only the two of us and have plenty of leftovers that I froze for couple of more dinners.

Easy recipe and a lot of food.
Family loves it. Fresh basil is best to use inside and as a garnish.
so good! my first lasagna and it came out great

Wow, I can't say enough about this recipe. Being a vegetarian for 50 years, , my lasagna never tasted as good as this. Used my own marinara sauce, added garlic, green pepper, mushrooms and zucchini. Lasagna was so moist and delicious.. mouth watering..
Was incredibly good. I added a few extra red pepper flakes and everyone loved it. Nobody missed the meat.
I put different veggies (sweet potato leaves, carrots, red bell pepper, zucchini, onion & garlic) and it came out great. Will make again.

I subbed out mushrooms and added chopped red pepper and half slices of zucchini. What I also did is end with a thin layer of ricotta mix, and then addEd a layer of egg on Top to finish. It’s so so good!
This was a huge hit with my vegetarian guests!! Best they have ever had!! I added green and yellow zucchini. So hearty and yummy as leftovers!!

Great recipe! I used the recipe, but used yellow bell pepper instead of green, added squash, and added spinach to the ricotta and mozzarella mixture. It was delicious! Make sure you place foil under the dish to catch any spillage just as the video says. The water from the vegetables ( especially if you add squash ) could run out of the dish.

Our favourite! We’ve tried with various veggies: carrots, eggplant, zucchini, mushrooms, celery, peppers, garlic, onion, spinach, cauliflower, sweet potatoes, chives etc. Whatever veggie found in the fridge! I use the smallest blade of my Vidalia veggie cutter for even al dente cooking. I use crushed tomatoes with a teaspoon of sugar to balance acidity instead of pasta sauce. Yummy!
Absolutely LOVE this recipe. This is my go to. I add spinach and zucchini and it’s a huge hit
Excellent!

Fantastic lasagna! I did everything plus added a few things. I added sauteed zucchini in with Baby Bellas and also added two generous pinches of a spice blend called Aglio Olio E Pepperocino which you can buy through spice companies (mine is from Whole Spice) because it just takes the jarred sauce to restaurant heights.
EXCELLENT! This is the first lasagna I've ever made that wasn't soupy and had defined layers. Only changes I made were adding spinach and carrots. Great flavor, highly recommend.
Delicious lasagna. Some members of our family don't like mushrooms so we simply substituted with zucchini slices.

Amazing base recipe!!! Read all the reviews! I used 8 oz sliced mushrooms and added 1/2 medium squash, 1/2 medium zucchini, 1 bag spinach, skipped green pepper. Used 1 jar flavored sauce, added one can of sauce and doubled basil. Only used 12 noodles total. Boil closer to 8 minutes. Used one last light layer of sauce before mozzarella topping. Delicious!!!!!
Added yellow squash , spinach
Best I have ever made. Used the veg I had in hand (carrots, broccoli, squash, zucchini, and mushrooms). Thank you, this one is a keeper!

Very good!!! I took a chance and made it for the first time for dinner guests.... it was a hit!! I cut back on the onions and peppers a little and added spinach to the ricotta mixture. I used my homemade sauce instead of store bought and cut it back by half, it would have been way too much sauce. Definitely make again!
Very tasty. I’ll definitely make it again.

The proportions were right, and quick recipe! kids loved it, my son has been requesting this for a while, second time I tried this after a disaster recipe I caught a while back! I did add a few poblano peppers as my kids eat on the spicier side..

This is a great veggie lasagna recipe. After reading other reviews, I decided to use 1.5 jars of sauce, less noodles, and I added zucchini. I think next time I will add spinach, as well. I also use sliced mozzarella cheese, which is a quick way to layer it on evenly.

This is a recipe for keeps. I have made this 4 times and every time I have got compliments on how yummy it is. I never have left overs when I make this dish. I add additional veggies such as zucchini. My kids always eat this with no fuss !
My family and I love this recipe! We double the ingredients plus add carrots, zucchini, and mushrooms. It's enough to feed 8 people comfortably.

We were having friends over for dinner on New Year’s Eve and I was making traditional lasagne but wanted to make another one for some variety.
I’m soooo glad I picked this recipe!! I used ShopRite pasta sheets instead of boiling pasta noodles (they’re a little thinner and very tender when baked). I also decided to add some shredded rotisserie chicken to this recipe (but it turned out so flavorful that it really wasn’t needed).
It was absolutely delicious, not dry at all. 
Even when reheated it was still moist.
My company said it was restaurant-worthy!!

Great recipe with tons of flavor. I also added spiraled zucchini noodles, diced green/red/yellow peppers, ginger spice blend paste and sautéed kale. My family loved it and the spectrum of colors was also appealing. This is one of my go-to favorites!!!

I did make a couple changes. I added ground beef to the sauce, half a cup of water and only used 1 jar. I chopped fresh spinach and added it to the ricotta cheese mixture. I also used ready to bake lasagna noodles.
My family absolutely loved this meal!

One thing that appealed to me about this recipe was how many adaptations of it there were in the reviews. I used mushrooms, eggplant, onion and green pepper, and Barilla marinara sauce. My husband loved it, as did I. I used two bottles of sauce, as the recipe suggests and did not find it to be excessive.
very tasty! I skipped the onions, but it did not detract from the effect. I should point out that I boiled all the lasagna noodles and ended up with too many.
This is a great tasting lasagna! It brings rave reviews from family! I also add spinach.

The instructions were confusing for a beginner. Do I mix the ricotta, eggs, and mozzarella in a different pan? When do I stop mixing it? Until it looks like a spread? It’s cooking now. Waiting to find out how it tastes
This will be great for a crowd, I just added a lot more vegetables, salt and used a spicier tomato sauce after reading other reviews that were actually quite helpful.

This was awesome. The video was helpful, too. I changed the vegetables and used my own sauce recipe. It was very tasty and will be my go-to for family gatherings (i.e. Thanksgiving for vegetarians) :)

I followed this as written. I wish I cut my mushrooms a little smaller so they came out softer. The slices I had were rather thick. I did have too many noodles. Only needed 12. Now that that's out of the way this was great! Just as good the next day if not better.
This is a family favorite. I made mine using no-boil lasagna noodles. I didn't even need to simmer the sauce and vegetables before assembling the lasagna. It was super easy and turned out perfectly.

I added eggplant, yellow and green zucchini.
Also this recipe allowed me to make one to eat now and one to freeze for latter, had to double the ricotta cheese mixture for two but --- OHMY Goodness this is the BEST LASAGNA I have had in my life. I will never go back..EVER!
THANK YOU FOR YOUR RECIPE
I substituted black beans for mushrooms and it was delicious!
I think it's a good base but bland as-is, and leaving people missing meat.
I made this but used veggies i needed to use up in the fridge. Squash, bok choy, yellow pepper, big bulb green onion and mixed gourmet mushrooms. it was really good

I served to ten of my friends and received many compliments; however, I added salt to my serving and saw that a couple of my friends did also. I will add salt to the sauce next time. I also added more mushrooms than the recipe called for.
It needs way more sauce and veggies and cheese, very dry upon reheating. Also very little veggies. Not hearty.

Used my own sauce, roasted broccoli, red pepper diced and carrots chopped, added shredded zucchini, and mixed ricotta w/ spinach. Family dinner and they all enjoyed it. Definitely a hearty meal. Made one tray gluten free for my daughter. Great family dinner! Modify veggies any way you like them.
Added baby spinach
Pretty good. Added broccoli, celery, and used a red onion. Also went with different flavored sauces for each jar of pasta sauce.
It is by far the best vegetable lasagna I have ever made. Everyone that eats it, can't believe that it is vegetable lasagna they swear that it is beef.
I made this just subbed a few vegetables to my liking and it was very good. Thanks for the recipe!

This was a very good recipe. I made a few changes used red and yellow peppers instead of green, added carrots, broccoli and spinach and added cottage cheese to the ricotta. It was very very tasty. Everyone including my husband who does not like anything vegetable loved it. Will keep in my to make again file. Thanks for sharing.

I made a half pan with sausage and the other half with veggies according to this recipe. It made a It was great to meet with you today Lenten meal with meat leftovers. I always use ricotta in my lasagna so stuck with my basic prep.
I put in spinach and carrots. Definitely will make again.

Pleasing the whole family is hard. My boys loved this! One son loves cheese and not veggies. One loves veggies and not cheese. This was a nice compromise. I used Romano instead of parmesan. I will definitely make this again!!

I made this lasagne and my family loved it! They did not miss the meat ??. I did add extra veggies: Broccoli, Zucchini, Squash. I also added fresh sautéed spinach to the ricotta mixture. My family are picky eaters so I recommend this recipe to every household. I will try this again vegan and see how it’s cones out????
Very delicious & easy to follow, even for those making veggie lasagna for the first time like myself :)
Loved it!

The best lasagna we’ve ever tasted! I make this so often now, and everyone loves it. It's perfect for people with dietary restrictions such as meat, onions, etc.; and the best part is that you can change it according to what you have in your fridge.
I used spinach, mushrooms, added some other cheeses. Its amazing.
Absolutely loved this recipe. My 5 year old and 8 year old could not get enough! The only sub I made was to cut the mushrooms in half and replaced it with fresh spinach. A new family favourite!

Added 2 medium zucchini and 2 diced carrots. Delicious to the vegetarians in the family. The non-vegetarians prefer lasagna with meat, but thought this recipe was okay. So it depends on who you are serving.

This is my second time making this . I used a white jar sauce didn't notice it ask for the other. Also added spinach ( rinsed canned) what had on hand and cottage cheese ( hubby doesn't like ricotta).Last use Reg egg noodles (what I had). Anyway like this making this time w/red sauce and spinach. Don't like mushrooms.

Great structure that allows you to play around with the ingredients. Getting the sauce the right consistency is key; allow it to cool down before layering it on top of your cheese mix. Add jalapeño or anything you want! I threw in some chopped fresh basil to the sauce. Play around, have fun. It’s as much of an art as it is a science.
I added some more parmesan cheese to the top of the dish.
This is simply the best lasagna I have made.

Loved it. The proportions were perfect. I added lots of salt to the veggies while cooking (I find this necessary for flavor) and I used two handfuls of spinach and fewer mushrooms instead of bell pepper which I can’t stand. Shared it with my roommate and she loved it too. Will definitely make it again.
Used a butternut squash sauce instead of traditional red sauce awesome!
Easy to make and delicious.

Like many others stated..you NEED to add some seasoning. I added oregano and Italian seasoning. I added a tbsp of red wine to bring the flavor out. I used broccoli, carrots, red/green peppers, and spinach. Also, I used low-fat ricotta cheese and layered it with low-fat mozzarella. I used a jar and a half of the sauce. I think it came out yummy.
It was very delicious! My hubby loved it, too!!
Wow! What a fantastic lasagna! Huge hit amongst guests and easy to make!
I used yellow and green zuchinni, fresh spinach and added oregano and Italian spices to the sauce! Also, I used cottage cheese instead of ricotta. I will definitely make this again.

We loved this wonderful recipe...however the photo is a misrepresentation of the recipe as it clearly includes broccoli and does not have near the amount of spaghetti sauce. I would like to get the recipe for the lasagna in the photo too :-). The video appears to be spot on. Irregardless, I appreciate the time Sue took to create and share this delicious dish!

I've been looking for a lasagna with mushrooms and this is a great one! I used portobellos, red peppers instead of green, a grated zucchini and grated carrot in the pan with the onions and garlic. Don't forget to add a good amount of Salt and Pepper--with all these veggies, it needs it. I also added frozen chopped spinach to the ricotta. I didn't use all the lasagna noodles (the pan was full to the top with 3 layers). This was moist and delicious.
As other viewers suggested, I added the spinach to the ricotta and I added zucchini, broccoli and carrots. It was delicious!

We made some slight modifications and served it at a Progressive Dinner with our neighbors. Got lots of compliments! I added 2 cups spinach (next time I will probably add 4) and I layered the veggies instead of mixing in the sauce. It was delicious.

Such a good classic staple recipe! I change the veggie mixture up a little bit. I do broccoli, red onion, mushroom, and sliced eggplant. Otherwise the recipe is the same and it comes out great every time.

Haven't made it yet but it looks easy enough and also easy enough to add what ever your hearts desire to it. I was think zucchini and broccoli would be good. Sense I don't care for mushrooms though I'd probably saute' separately and only add them to the top so that I can easily remove them and still allow others who do like to have them. Just my thought for ideas.

Well, this was certainly a fun dish! My Girlfriend and I made this together. We had a blast! It came out so well, we have to make this again. We topped this with Ramano. It was perfect. This wil always be a go-to dish from now on.
This was great, and makes A TON. We have leftovers for the rest of the week!

I used cottage cheese instead of ricotta, based on personal preference. That was the best lasagna I've ever had! Didn't miss the meat at all. I imagine you could use almost any vegetable combination and it would be good.

This is a wonderfully hearty recipe that my husband gives 2 thumbs up to. I did not use nearly as many lasagna noodles and I used the oven ready kind which worked out great. I used all the vegetables called for in the recipe, but can see that many other vegetables could be added in. Thanks for this great recipe.

I will likely never add meat to my lasagna ever again this was so good. I did make some slight changes. I added spinach and the vegetable medley to the ricotta mixture and instead of going the traditional route I laid out the noodles and added the mixture and then rolled them up placed them in rows of 3 smothered them with sauce and sprinkled them with cheese then baked
I’ve been making this for years-everyone loves it! I use red instead of green peppers and add fresh spinach and shredded carrots.

Delicious! I only tweaked it a bit. As I don’t care for cooked green peppers, I omitted them. I also added fresh spinach on top of the cheese layers. I also grate fresh Parmesan for added flavor. Buy the Parmesan by the brick. You’ll never go back to the pregrated stuff on the shelf.
Absolutely delicious Lasagna! Best I've ever made, several people have asked me for my new recipe, so happy to share!
An easy and delicious take on vegetable lasagna. I loved it and so did my hubby. Thanks for sharing it.

This was a wonderful meal and was made for company along with the meat version. Everyone enjoyed it! I added about 2-3 cups of steamed broccoli o th sauce which made it mor meatier. I will definitely use this recipe again as a base to make again.
Have made this many times and always great.
Despite a few mistakes, this recipe was just what I needed for the best-tasting vegetarian lasagna I ever had!
This is very delicious. I actually think I like this better than having meat
sooo good! I like that it still tastes like traditional lasagna. Like most other reviewers, I added chopped carrots and zucchini and also chopped spinach to the ricotta mixture.
Wonderful! Made this for Christmas dinner for my sister and her vegetarian family. They loved it!

I served this as the main entree to my family for Christmas Eve dinner, and it was a HUGE hit! We have vegetarians and carnivores, and everyone loved it. 

As suggested by other reviewers, I added 1 16 oz bag of thawed and drained frozen spinach, and a hodge podge of other veggies (2 medium carrots chopped, broccoli tops chopped, 
1 red bell pepper chopped, 8 oz of mushrooms chopped, 2 zucchini chopped). 

I omitted the egg to the cheese mixture, and it was fine. I added 30 oz of pasta sauce, which seemed to be just right (not dry but not soupy at all). I was flummoxed as to why I have lots of cooked but unused lasagna noodles remaining unused, as I generously used noodles to fill a 9X13 pan. All in all, this was a home run and one that will be seen in the post season many times! Thank you for sharing your recipe, Sue!

We all thought this was delicious. We made homemade sheets of pasta for the noodles and added chopped fresh spinach to the ricotta mixture - those were our only changes. We also used the "Best Marinara Sauce Yet" recipe along with this - would definitely make it again and I rarely make the same thing twice. Yum!

This was actually a pretty easy recipe and it came out perfectly. My boyfriend raved about it for days. I added a few extra ingredients: shredded carrots, fresh spinach, zucchini, broccoli, a 1/2 cup more ricotta cheese and fresh basil instead of dried. Yummy!
